Key Match Events: Kagiso Rabada run out (Mohammad Nawaz/Haris Rauf)
Anrich Nortje c Mohammad Haris b Haris Rauf
Pre-Game Insights: South Africa are the only unbeaten side and would've had a full house of points had weather not intervened on their victory march against Zimbabwe.
Pakistan have not been able to score enough runs and have not scored them very quickly either.
Pakistan's problems at the top of their line-up are largely due to the struggles of Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan.

Pakistan have played seven T20Is against South Africa, Babar has scored 259 runs (at 37.00 with a strike rate of 143.09) with a hundred and a fifty while Rizwan has scored 344 runs (at 86.00 with a strike rate of146.38) including a hundred and three half-centuries.
Post-Match Reflections: David Miller is South Africa's most capped T20I player and he believes his years in the game are starting to count
Pakistan's defeat to India is not still on their minds, according to Naseem Shah
Miscellaneous Highlights: This match will be played on the same pitch as the Sri Lanka-New Zealand game, where Trent Boult took a career-best 4 for 13.
The average first innings score in Sydney at this tournament so far is 188, the highest of the venues used.
Others: Pakistan have a 3-0 win record against South Africa at the T20 World Cup, even though they last met in 2012.
